intro: Glycosmis mauritiana var. insularis, commonly known as the Socotra tamarind, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Socotra. It is a small shrub or tree characterized by its distinctive, pinnate leaves and yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that contain a single seed, which is encased in a hard, woody sarcocarp. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to the harsh conditions of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a valuable species for botanical research and conservation efforts.
